N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1035.4 - Suspension of service

State Regulations
(a) The
authority may suspend, for a reasonable period of time, paratransit service to
an eligible individual for the following reasons: (1)
a pattern of missing scheduled
trips; (2)
failure to pay the
fare; (3)
violent, seriously
disruptive, or illegal conduct during a paratransit trip; or
(4)
failure to follow any rule of conduct
that is established. (b) Except for suspensions for violent or seriously disruptive conduct, before
suspending service, the authority shall: (1)
notify the individual in writing that the authority proposes to suspend
service, citing with specificity the basis of the proposed suspension and
setting forth the proposed sanction; (2)
provide the individual with an
opportunity to be heard and to present information and arguments; and
(3)
provide the individual with written
notification of the decision and the reasons for it. (c) In the case of suspensions for violent, seriously disruptive or illegal conduct during a paratransit trip, an
individual will be subject to immediate suspension, but will be entitled to a
post-suspension hearing, which shall in all other respects conform to the
procedures for pre-suspension hearings set forth in subdivision (b) of this
section. (d) The appeal process of
section
1035.3
(i)-(l)
of
this Part is available to individuals who have been suspended pursuant to this
section. Except for suspensions for violent, seriously disruptive or illegal
conduct, the suspension will not be imposed pending the outcome of the
appeal. Notes
